description: Sadly just another Electron app. It does a good job of automatically logging you in. It does not show up as a Mail app so it cannot be registered as your default Mail app in Gnome. Additionally the .desktop file that gets created doesn't contain enough info so searching for "mail" doesn't show this app as a result.
summary: A functional but minimally integrated app

description: The app is essentially an Electron wrap for Protonmail's web client. Its perfectly functional in that though. Only gripe I have is it only lets you access your /home/Downloads folder when attaching files. Theres probably a work around but I havent found one yet. Other than that, this app works really well if you dont want the hassle of using Proton Bridge and a typical email client like Thunderbird. Also the Proton Calendar works in this now too.

summary: Does not work on Debian Gnome

description: It's the perfect linux client for free users with more than one protonmail.
tengo añadidas dos cuentas y funciona perfectamente, gracias
